Description: Papyrus written with black ink with funerary text and black line vignette on recto (ll. 3-4 in demotic; the remainder is pseudo-hieratic); additional demotic text on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Hieroglyphic and demotic papyrus containing magical spells serving as an amulet equivalent to a copy of the Book of the Dead. recto. Top: figure of Anubis & the deceased 2 ll. of hieroglyphs followed by one of demotic ("his soul lives for ever - may it be renewed!") & the rest in hieroglyphs. verso. one line of demotic writing - almost the same as before".
Curator's comments: Published in S. P. Vleeming, Demotic and Greek-Demotic Mummy Labels and Other Short texts gathered from Many Publications (Studia Demotica 9; Leuven: Peeters), no. 1170.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (54005) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/54005)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
